conclusion: To determine whether the accelerations of both objects A and B are first increasing and then decreasing during the time interval from 0 to t1, we need to analyze the slopes of their respective velocity-time (v-t) graphs.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
On a v-t graph, acceleration is represented by the slope of the tangent to the curve at any given point.
If the slope is positive, the object is accelerating; if negative, it is decelerating.
The magnitude of the slope indicates the magnitude of the acceleration.
At t = 0, the slope of the curve for object A is zero because the velocity starts from zero.

conclusion: As time progresses, the slope of the curve increases, indicating that the acceleration is increasing.
